top_comment.text:
i am a little disappointed that this video was a little less informative 
about tips and tricks that a Guan Yu can do and how to counter him compared 
to the first 2 videos that you made about Neith and Ymir! i can list you 
even more tricks and tips! please take this as constructive feedback 
because i feel like you missed on these points! for example and this is the 
most important thing about Guan Yu that players always seem to not know 
about is how to control the Ulti! it is a new form of movement that cant be 
steered by the WASD but does in fact steer with your mouse and your forward 
and back buttons! if you push your forward button (W) you move faster if 
you press (S) you slow down and by doing so it makes it easy to get those 
Ulti hits on your enemy by speeding or slowing down if you have some gods 
that juke you and this trick can help! another trick is that if you start 
your attack with your dash and channel the 3 seconds Taolu assault it is 
guaranteed to hit the full 3 seconds on your enemy because they are slowed 
down plus at the same time the dash will get CD reduction because you are 
using another skill and it will get off CD for you to be able to chase down 
the enemy again! another trick also is that Toulo assault pushes the enemy 
minions back so its a great tool specially in the solo lane to push the the 
melee minions back to the range minions and then be able to hit your dash 
on all of the minions guaranteed to get them all! last but not least the 
best way to counter Guan Yu is to hit him with CC before he hits you! if 
you can disrupt a Guan Yu full frontal attacks by denying him the ability 
to engage and start fights then you can easily win because Guan Yu rely too 
much on his skills rather than his Auto-Attacks so if he get the CD rolling 
the best way to stop it is by locking him down! i really hope that the next 
videos will be more informative like the Neith and Ymir because i was 
really disappointed of the lack of tricks and tips on this one... Guan Yu 
is my favorite God and i was really looking forward to this video :(﻿

comments.author: TrendKiLLv01

top_comment.text:
Guan Yu will shit on you... only a noob would think Guan Yu is bad or you 
never seen a good Guan Yu yet.  I have only lost 1 out of 12 of my recent 
matches with Guan Yu...  Guan Yu certainly shits on people and I have 1v2'd 
many people with Guan you and forced them to stop fighting me.  I will list 
all the reasons why Guan Yu does not suck below.  If your a noob you will 
probably have to open the "Read more Tab below" because if your noob enough 
to call Guan Yu bad your also noob enough to not know how to open the rest 
of my comment explaining why Guan Yu does not suck.
*Why Guan Yu does not suck*

His Taolu Assault (3) does like 550 fucking base damage at max rank, and it 
steals 30 protections.  First off al realize that is a lot of fucking 
damage and mostly nobody is going to want to fight Guan Yu when he is 
dealing all of that damage to your face meanwhile gaining defense while 
your losing defense.  YES Steal protections means that not only is Guan Yu 
gaining your protections but he is also TAKING THEM FROM YOU meaning you 
are weaker and have 30 less protections when you keep getting hit by his 
3.  That move zones like hell as well, I have 1v2 people because they chase 
me and I just back away while 3ing them and they do not want to chase me 
any more after the realize I will just zone them while running backwards 
then heal up.  So this move pretty much allows Guan Yu to 1v1 MOST note 
MOST Gods in the game who cannot cancel this ability.

His heal (1) - Yes his heal is weak by itself, but its not his weak heal 
that makes him good, his passive is okay but its not even the fact that his 
passive makes up for part of his weak heal.  The fact that his heal heals 
team mates as well is already better than a regular heal.  On top of this 
it reduces all your cooldowns by 2 seconds??? Yes, I don't know about you 
but a CD reduction heal that heals my team as well is not shit.  Yes the 
heal is weak but with the 2 forms of CD reduction Guan Yu has in his kit he 
can spam his heal on his team to the point where he has a strong heal and 
he sustains his team and lanes.

His dash warriors will (2) - This ability isn't that great by itself, its 
damage is okay and the slow is just good for using your 3.  What makes this 
ability great is the fact ONCE AGAIN it reduces all your cooldowns by 2 
seconds... so combined with your heal that means Guan Yu can CONSTANTLY 
REDUCE HIS COOLDOWNS BY 4 SECONDS over and over again.  That means he can 
spam shit over and over and his ult comes back fast, his heal comes back 
fast and his damage comes back meanwhile you are waiting on your long ass 
cooldowns while he is healing up his team and doing what he wants with his 
other abilities.

Guan Yu's ULT (4) - This is what makes Guan Yu SHIT on people.  His ult 
literally SHITS on people.  It is the MOST DAMAGING PHYSICAL ULT IN THE 
GAME!!!  That means if you eat his fucking ult you will be dead unless he 
went tanky.  His ult makes most Gods unable to escape him, the damage on 
his ult means most Gods will not survive after getting hit with all of it, 
the fact that its a team fight ult and he can hit an entire team with that 
damage, and the fact that it stuns at the end makes Guan Yu a damn beast.  
Once you get your ult you almost have a free kill on whoever eats your ult.

Guan Yu DAMAGE is WAAAAY SUPERIOR to Guan Yu tanky...  trust me, I have 
played many tank builds and some are okay but damage Guan just shits way 
harder, when you go too tanky your ult does not do what its suppose to, 
when you build to tanky your just healing and not doing enough damage to 
kill.  When you build damage people strait up DIE from you left and right.

I prove Guan Yu does not suck, play him in solo lane and do this.

#1 Buy transcendace as your first item on him in solo lane before boots.  
Ya, think it sucks, until you realize that you have a shit ton of mana to 
spam heals and you have so much power from the stacks that your 3 and ult 
shits on everything you come in contact with.  Every time I bought 
transcendence I pretty much dominated my lane.  I seriously forgot about 
this item, one day I tried it on Guan Yu and I use it most of the time in 
Solo because I do so much damage with it and have more mana to spam 
abilities without having to back.

#2 Buy pen boots, CDR boots are food noobs, Guan already has CDR in his kit 
and pen is a actual stat that will deal more damage in combo with 
transendance.

#3 Buy Jotunns wrath, right now you probably have full stax on 
transcendence and with all of this damn pen from boots and jotunns in combo 
with a shit fuck ton of damage from your first item with stax, you will 
obliterate anyone who faces you in a strait 1v1 duel, if your ult is up its 
pretty much GG for them. 

I usually shit on the enemy God about 2-3 times by now and probably taken 
their tower by this time, usually the enemy team surrenders by this point 
but assuming they don't your next step is to judge how OP you are at this 
point.

If your super fed, fuck it just go more damage, buy something like brawlers 
beat stick for more pen and anti healing if they have Ra or Aphro, or just 
go buy witchblade to make you out box them even harder and speed yourself 
up.

I usually only pick up like 1 or 2 tank items MAX.  Mostly I build damage.

In solo, just 3 the wave, if they have someone who can stun you out of your 
3 then you have to use your 3 on the wave side ways, meaning you move 
sideways so its hard to hit you, most noobs just go strait into the wave 
and get outstunned which is why they think Guan Yu sucks dick but he 
doesn't.  Guan Yu actually clears pretty fast, and then just heal the wave 
up when they use an ability to troll them. 

The way you win solo is easy as shit.
Do damage to their wave, heal your wave up, then you LET THEM COME TO YOU.
You let them leave tower and troll them into fighting you.  Act like your 
going to back to make them want to stop you like all the trolls usually do, 
once they are too far from tower just jump on your fucking Horse and make 
them realize why they don't fuck with Guan Yu.

Your ult alone will either kill hem or almost kill them.  The stun at the 
end will just set up for your 3 or dash.  They basically DIE EVERY TIME.

Tell me Guan Yu is bad again?﻿

comments.author: Mega Sceptile

comments.text:
Spend a lot of time practicing hitting your Pillar>Spear combo. Set a 
obelisk directly behind an enemy and immediately shoot your spear to knock 
them into the wall for a stun. Since they're stunned in the sand you do 
increased damage to them and they can't stop you, so you can ult for a ton. 
The combo is really hard because the pillar is so small, but if you master 
it, he becomes really strong. Just make sure if they have an escape and 
they haven't used it yet, just auto instead of ulting after the stun. If 
you bait their leap/dash, hit the stun in the sand, you are guaranteed all 
8 spears on your ult with a 20% increase (with 1 at max rank) and with the 
enemy having 15 fewer protections from your passive.

He's a great boxer if you can keep them in the sand, otherwise, he's not so 
great, which is likely what seems so hard about him. He really requires 
knowing enemy cooldowns and baiting their escapes, or else he is super 
tough.
comments.author: MeiaLua

top_comment.text:
Why do all MOBAs have these gimmicky, dis-unified functions in hundreds of 
characters that forces the player to memorise tons and tons of small 
details about every character's skills to maximise their winning chances? I 
mean, is it a culture thing or do some gamers actually hate proper gameplay 
mechanics?

Forgive me, but I'm just beginning to get into MOBAs and man... There's a 
learning curve...﻿
top_comment.author: Bryan Lee

comments.text:
if all the gods/characters played the same then you would get bored very 
fast. The reason behind this learning curve is to add spice to the game, 
keep you interested long enough in every god and reward those who spent 
more time than others mastering their favorite gods.
comments.author: Tyler Durden

comments.text: +Udyr, The Spirit Walker I understand that now :) Thanks :D
comments.author: Bryan Lee

comments.text:
The reason there are so many skills is because it makes the game more 
tactical. If you know the opponent's skills and how they work, then you 
have an advantage.
comments.author: Udyr, The Spirit Walker

comments.text:
+Vui Tu Yeah, that's what interested me and got me into MOBAs :) I never 
saw the appeal of LoL or DotA, but Smite got my attention xD
comments.author: Bryan Lee

comments.text:
It's only a different approach and it's not just MOBA thing but RPG thing 
in general. For example shooters compensate their straightforward mechanics 
with different maps while RPGs compensate their lack of maps with different 
mechanics of their characters. Simply shooters are more performance based 
while RPGs are information games. What makes smite unique is that it's half 
a shooter and half an RPG :)
comments.author: Impractical Person

comments.text:
Same thing with fighting games btw.

Also I like to play competetive games with multiple characters just because 
of this. It makes them feelvery different and satesfying to learn and play 
against ;)

comments.text: +wesley meyer Still learning, but thanks for the advice :)
comments.author: Bryan Lee

comments.text:
You'll get used to it, and in the end it makes the characters feel more 
special,

captions.text:
What's going on everybody and welcome
back to the final three god episode's of

Know Your Enemy my name is Trendkill
let's get into it
"Dramatic intro "
So if you havent noticed there are always

10 free gods available in Smite. There
are 5 core gods that are always available

and 5 rotating gods that are
available every patch

This being the fifth episode will be the
last video we talk about the 5 free god's

and we will now move on to any gods
that are in rotation

So without further ado let's go ahead
and jump into the guide today we're gonna
be talking about Guan Yu
the Chinese Saint
of War

So if you watch this series before
you'll know that the first thing we do in

each episode is we take a look at a
visual representation of what each god
is good at

and the first thing you're gonna notice about Guan Yu
is that his graph is a little more

filled in than most of the other gods
that we've looked at

and that is because he is a warrior. Now
warriors are kind of like

in the middle between guardians and
assassins they can do

either role should they be built one way
or another so you're gonna see that

warriors are going to be a little more
jack of all trades rather than excelling
in one specific area

a good example of that would be to compare
him to all the other assassins or
compare him to all the other guardians.

Lets use guardians for example guardians
have a lot of initiation and separation
and hard CC abilities

where as Guan Yu's abilities are more
soft CC

but he's got cooldown reduction options
that allow him to use that soft CC more often

So you can see by looking at this graphic
that Guan Yu really not bad in any one spot

however damages is his lowest statistic on
this graph

but remember he is a physical god so if
he were to build physical damage items

his auto attacks and abilities are still
going to hurt, so just because he shows

low damage on this graph does not mean
that he doesn't have the capabilities

to do a lot of damage should he choose
to build that way.
Alright so lets move on and talk about his abilities if you remember from the Thor guide I told you that Thor
abilities are pretty straightforward

but the way you use them and the
mechanics behind them are a little more
tricky and required some explanation

Guan Yu is the opposite, his mechanics
and the way he plays in the game

pretty straightforward however his
abilities has some intricacies that I
think we need to talk about.
Let's start off with his

passive Painless this is not a kit
encompassing passive ability like Neith's
broken weaves

and I do think the tool tip is a bit
confusing

and need some explanation. So first things
first let's talk about the ability as

you take damage from different sources
or from the same source

you build up what is called Conviction
once you build up 20 stacks of Conviction

your next heal will be a double heal
so that increases

your healing by 100%. What
is not obvious from playing him for the
very first time

is that every single hit up to 20 will
add 5% up to

100% and you can get that by
very simple math 100% extra heal

divided by 20 stacks is 5% per
stack
up to 20 or 100%. So its going to be very rare that your heal is only going to
heal you for the base

amount your passive is almost always
going to come into play.
Now another thing they don't mention is that when you build up 20 stacks and you get your double heal,

that will clear your passive completely
and you will have to build up another 20 stacks

To a normal person that sounds pretty
obvious because otherwise it would be
completely overpowered.

However to a new player you may not
understand that and lastly this should

be pretty obvious based on the wording
however

make sure you understand whether you're
hit by a 1000 damage ability or a

1 damage ability that counts as one
stack more damage does not equal

more stacks. Now his first two abilities
Conviction, his heal

and Warriors Will, his dash are
externally just that a heal

and a dash, however internally they have
a built-in cooldown reduction mechanic

that as a little flavor and utility to
those two abilities

so essentially if I were to heal a
friendly God with Conviction

that would reduce all of my cooldowns by
two seconds
if I were to dash through an enemy god with Warriors Will that will again

reduced all of my ability cooldown by
two seconds now this

includes the abilities themselves so an
example

Conviction is a 10 second cooldown if I
were to heal a friendly god that would
start that cool down at 8 seconds

if I was then able to somehow dash
through an enemy that would again

reduce all of my cooldowns by another
two seconds which would make Conviction
essentially

a 6 second cooldown. Now as far his third  
ability Taolu Assault is concerned,

I wanna make sure I define protection stolen.
Stolen is not a word that you're gonna
see

often on a smite tool tips so what that
means is
is that Guan Yu

has the ability to take
protections from his enemies
and add them to himself. So at max rank,

at max stacks he was steal a total at
30 protections

from an enemy and add 30 protections to
himself

which is a 60 protection swing now
we've talked about not boxing people

when the passive of Taolu Assault is active
for that three second duration

you have to be very careful boxing him
because you are much weaker

and he is much stronger for those three
seconds. Now as far his ultimate Cavalry

Charge is concerned my god ability
does a ton of stuff first of

it does a lot of damage it does even
more damage if you get hit consecutively
during the ultimate

it also slows you and at the end of the ult,
stuns you. So you have to be very careful
around this

as long as you read the ability it
should be pretty straightforward however

the one tricky thing that most other
gods in smite don't have is a damage
escalation so

if you get caught in his ultimate you
have to do everything you can to get out

otherwise he's going to pour on the
damage

Alright so on to the mechanic section
remember I told you that Guan Yu
mechanics are not all that complicated

so you're gonna see that this is a very bottom heavy
list most to the tips I have for you are
going to be about Taolu Assault and

Cavalry Charge however lets speed through
Conviction and Warrior Will first

these two abilities mechanically are
very straightforward

and we've got most of the technical
stuff out of the way when we were talking about
the highlighted the abilities earlier.

So as far as Conviction tips are
concerned remember that any god with an
aoe heal can be extremely annoying
to lane against. Guan Yu, Hel, Ra,

Sylvanus all of these gods can not only
heal themselves

and their teammates but also the minions
that are in the lane with them

now because he is a warrior you will often
see Guan Yu you played the guardian role

and play in the duo lane with a hunter
that could be really annoying for the

enemy duo lane because they are almost guaranteed
to be out pushed

so if you happen to see Guan Yu playing
the role of the enemy guardian

in the duo lane remember that you're
gonna have a much harder time
burning down his minions. As far as Warriors Will is concerned remember

to never underestimate the 20%
slow that this ability has.

That gives Guan just enough staying power
to be extremely annoying and always on
top of you.

If you couple that with all the cooldown
reduction from Conviction and Warriors Will

it's going to seem like he is
permanently Taolu Assaulting you and you
can't get away

because he's continually slowing you as
well, and god help you should he also

on top of all that have Sprint and or
some form of Creeping Curse

good luck. Now this next tip I got is for
both Warriers Will and

Taolu Assault, this is like a combo move but
first we have to understand that Warriors
Will, the dash is really Guan Yu's only burst damage.
Taolu Assault, damage over time, Cavalry Charge damage over time, Conviction is a heal

so Warriors Will is the only thing
that's going to do instant damage

at a high amount. Now I told you this was
a combo move between Warriors Will and Taolu Assault

so first off let's do some math and
compare the two abilities

So lets look at max rank and let's ignore
scaling for the time being just looking
at the base damage
Warriors Will at max rank will do 300 damage where Taolu Assault will do 55
damage per hit
for nine hits for total of 495 damage

also noticed that you max out your protection
stolen at three stacks but the ability
hits nine times

meaning that you're at full potential on
protection stolen in the first

second of a three-second ability now in
that first second you will deal 165 damage

in the last two seconds you will deal
330 damage

however remember his second ability
Warriors Will deals 300 damage now I'm

telling you all this because I have been
burned a couple times by trying to
Taolu Assault somebody to death

only for their jump or dash to come off of
cooldown and then to get away

because I try to use a three second
channel ability instead of relying on

instead damage. So if you happen to be
playing a Guan Yu who knows how to play

his character who knows the math behind
it

and knows what he has to do to kill you,
you can guarantee you're gonna see him

Taolu Assault for one second to get the
full potential out of the penetrations and
protection, cancel that and then

dash through you for the instant 
damage from Warriors Will that will deal a total

of 465 damaged versus an entire three
second channel Taolu Assault dealing 495.

So you save two seconds but deal 30
damage less

you can do a lot more and deal a lot more
than 30 damaged in two seconds

now while this scenario will not come up all
that often it's worth noting so that you
can kinda understand how you need to look at your abilities as you're playing these god

While this is a series teaching you how
to play against very specific gods

I wanna make sure I sprinkle little bits of
information like this
throughout the series so that you're not only learning something extremely specific

which also picking up general tips along
the way.

Now for his final ability Cavalry Charge
remember that during this ability at any time

Guan Yu can cancel the ability to make
sure that he lands the stunned that
happened at the end.

Now this mechanic gives this tip a lot
more use, than if you just had to go through
the entire ultimate to get the stun. This can be an extremely nasty way to open a team fight
because the enemy team might be expecting you to just run in and start slashing everything up

but they're going to spread out if you
do that, so just jumping on your horse and

canceling it just to get the big
stun in the team fight may catch

three or four people in the stun and if
it does thats a humongous

advantage for your team for that fight.
Another use for this is stealing

objectives like Gold Fury of Fire
Giant, a lot of the times when people are

getting an objective their bunched up
around it

so what you can do is run in on your
horse hop off stun everybody and Hand Of The Gods it

to steal it right at the
last second. Guan Yu is an amazing

objectives stealer and you're gonna see
this a lot more than you might think and

for my last tip and I can't find any math or
numbers behind this but

from testing it seems that Cavalry
Charge increases your base movement
speed by a certain percentage

so what that means is no matter how fast
you're currently going Cavalry Charge will make you go faster.
So using Cavalry Charge with just boots, will make you go fast.

Using it with boots and speed buff and
Sprint will make you go
insanely fast. So never count Guan Yu you out of a team fight because he can
engage from a pretty far distance away. Also he's pretty safe to disengage should he

need to get out of a fight Cavalry
Charge is a great way to do that.
so there you go. Five gods down and only fifty something left.

Anyways guys hopefully learn some stuff
today and hopefully come by next week.
We're gonna talk about Anhur The Egyptian Slayer
Of Enemys
Ps mamacita is the best

title: SMITE Know Your Enemy #5 - Guan Yu
